intro: Convolvulus festivus, commonly known as the festive convolvulus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm. The plant features opposite, hairy leaves and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. The flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
